intro: Dianthus × saxatilis nothosubsp. varians, commonly known as the variable rock campion, is a hybrid plant that exhibits a range of morphological variations. It is typically found in rocky or gravelly habitats, often in alpine or arctic regions. The species features showy, pink to red flowers with five petals, and its leaves are usually narrow and hairy. It is characterized by its adaptability to harsh environments and its ability to thrive in poor soils. This nothosubspecies is a result of natural hybridization between Dianthus saxatilis and other related species.
